olP0lpmKWWGk3nflwwjkXQ.text: Thai restaurant in Singapore with several branches. Authentic Thai food at very affordable prices. Been here a few times when I crave Thai food. Curries, veggie dishes and Pad Thai are pretty good safe bets. Basil chicken a bit salty. Their Thai milk tea is very sweet though. Portion is a bit small - would recommend ordering a lot of dishes to share / sample.

HT-xwkvYXRHgUzBZP-X1Pw.text: 2 of us queued up just before the outlet was opened for business. Yet we were treated like invisible. The rude woman just waved and the staff showed the 3 of them to a table, bypassing us. When I proceed indoor to take the last table, the staff made us to take the outdoor table which was pretty hot given it was noon time and there was no fan blowing outside whereas indoor there's fans on. Reason given that we were 2 persons, whereas the other groups got 3 persons. What kind of treatment was this! Yet when I was paying I could spot guys of 2 taking the tables for 4 indoor.Bad experience!Don't come here for small groups!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore

7iK97JK2nnhWg65zi7H7sA.text: Decent Prices for Average Food. There's something about Thai food that captivates everyone. Whether it's the over the top, burn your mouth off chilli or that combination of flavours that evokes all your senses at once, Thai food never fails to warm your heart and make you crave for more. Being a regular at Holland Village, we've seen the super long queues for Nakhon Kitchen and it's always made us wonder just how good the food is. We finally had the chance to try when, amazingly, there were less than 10 people in the queue. Waiting time was around 15 mins considering that most people had wanted to sit indoors instead of outside in the sweltering hit. Having a few favourite thai joints, we had to try some of our favourites. Tom Ka Chicken Soup ($6) Unlike most people who go on the search for the best Tom Yum soup, I love my Tom Ka. I love myself a god Tom yum but Tom Ka elevates that sour tanginess with the rich, smooth, sweetness of the coconut milk. There's was a good portion of chicken and mushroom and while it offered that tangy kick, it was a little light on the coconut milk. While it gave it that milky colour, the sweetness and richness of the coconut milk didn't shine through as much. Pineapple Curry with Mussels ($8)The one thing I admire about thai curries is their ability to use fresh fruits into their curry, adding that extra level of sweetness to compliment to spiciness and sourness. The curry here was pretty nice, thicker than I expected but really spicy and Because of that spiciness, it didn't really do much for the mussels. While the mussels were large and fresh, they didn't add a lot of flavour into the curry and vice versa. Maybe because there were only 5 mussels. Ironically, when I took the dish home, added in some coconut milk and cooked it with fish, it turned out to be a very good fish curry. Stir fried Kai Lan with mushrooms ($6)Kai Lan was not overcooked, which was nice. Mushroom, sliced, were juicy but the overall dish was just a bit too salty for me. I love the use of thai oyster sauce in vegetables, I use it a lot too in mine but this was just too heavy on the sauce. Thai Iced Tea ($3)This had to be the biggest let down for me. At $3, it was probably the most diluted or weak thai iced tea I've had. Overall, the food was decent but at the prices, I could see why they were so popular. Unfortunately for me, it really felt like the crowds were there more for the price than for how good the food actually is. For me, I'd still rather pay a little more and stick to my favourite Thai restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore

v-zo2Eq9zud5pwfHpi2qdQ.text: Ok, not the best Thai food in the world, but probably the best value-for-your-money Thai food in Singapore. There's usually a queue here for dinner, even late into a weekday evening around 9pm, so just prepare yourself. They serve authentic Thai food including all the classics and a killer sticky mango rice dessert. The prices are very affordable for a serviced restaurant with seating and free napkins, and they don't have GST or service charge! My only qualm is the pork floss on top of the pineapple fried rice, which seems like a very Singaporean-style of preparation. Still, save yourself from the food court, Black Canyon, or Thai Express and eat at Nakhon next time you have a craving! I believe there's three locations throughout Singapore.

ozZT90DUwEQ9zk1xDP_scg.text: Came here with the recommendation of a friend who loves Thai food. He said that I may have to queue. I get suspicious whenever there's queue outside a restaurant in Singapore. Nevertheless, I gave it a shot. Arrived 10 minutes earlier as I don't believe in queueing for food. Order was taken and the nice lady told me with a smile that once the store it's opened, we will be served promptly. Very nice.Ordered Tom Yam soup, $6 and my favorite Phad Thai $5. The restaurant was half full 2 minutes after opening. Food arrived pretty quickly. Dug into Phad Thai and the soup. My heart sank. Why is it so sweet? The Phad Thai appeared to have a big bunch of sugar in it. Like wise for the soup. I have made both dishes at home and it can taste good without the sugar load. I looked around me and I can see patrons tucking enthusiastically into the sugar bin. For the easy on the pocket prices, I can see why it's so popular.Came here a second time and was hoping it will be better. The green curry chicken is horrible. It's frozen chicken and paste at best.

4pA2usFfutyIgsWbA1gC8A.text: I'm only gradually getting used to waiting in line for food and typically I am not amused by a long line but WOW, this was worth the wait: this is the best Thai food I've had outside Thailand and it is super affordable!I came here on a Tuesday evening and it was the only place in Holland V which had a long line but I decided to give it a go anyway.  Good thing the line moved fast but we still had to wait for 45 mins but as it was not very hot outside, we enjoyed people watching. Also, it gave me enough time to extensively study the menu and decide what to get. A bonus is also that after a while they took our order whilst still being in line so once we got to our seats our food was served super fast.The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, it was obviously super busy but not in an annoying "full cantine" type of way, it was just bustling and when seated outside you could still enjoy the live music from Bar Bar Black Sheep across the street. I actually like that they use fans instead of aircon, this creates a cozier environment instead of a sterile place. The staff was very helpful which was unexpected since they were so busy.And then the food... Super delicious! We had the Shrimp Tom Yum soup, I am typically not a Tom Yum fan but this was super yummy (sorry for the bad pun).Since my dining companion preferred not to go for spicy dishes (except for the Tom Yum soup which had quite a kick), we went for the spring rolls, chicken in pandan leaves, green curry and pad thai. All of these dishes were fantastic, they tasted clean and had the right balance.I was in a pretty good mood when the check arrived as I noticed that there was no service or gst added. 27$ for two persons, what a bargain!Will I go again? You bet! Who doesn't love cheap, delicious food and good service?

h4JbdL0iBoXa6FiOaaEHGw.text: Busy, they don't take credit cards and they forget your order... food's pretty good though! I loved the mango salad

xcFns9iZ5q3PGIykjbgm0w.text: An authentic Thai makan place. Their food are really good.....often orders their Basil pork (spicy and right amount of sweetness), stir-fried squid in yellow curry, kang Kong and of course, tom yam soup.Get prepare to perspire with the spice & freshly hot cook food.Oh yes, I always order the Fanta Green, it something that Singapore use to have long time ago..Bon Apertit...

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore. My bill for take-out...$102. It was worth the wait & value.

7XdiUhoMJWT_pQNvqCS-3Q.text: The queue at this place is incredible. We arrived at 11:45am but the place only opens at noon sharp. We started the queue and soon there were quite a number of people behind us. Once the shutters open, everyone shuffled in and each waiter got assigned to a table. The service was very prompt without any compromise on quality of the food. The pandan chicken and prawn cakes were the highlight among our dishes. I felt that the Pad Thai did not have the wok hei smell. The prawns in the tom yum soup were big and fresh. The lemongrass drinks were also very refreshing as only the fans were switched on but not the air con.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore. Pad Thai

qFujs06JBJehKM2br3HKaQ.text: Excellent  authentic  resto. Went on  a Saturday  arvo at lunch time.  Queue  was short.  We had minced beef salad, tom yam with prawns  and kangkong with belacan. The kangkong was not very spicy but definitely  could taste  the kick from the  belacan. Tom yam was with a clear broth and perfect  sour yet spicy taste. The mince beef salad was refreshing.  All up only 21 SGD. Well worth  it!

cO82NVt4NArc4ktQ9CcsXw.text: This hole-in-the-wall, hawker-center like restaurant (no AC, outdoors) has one of the best, authentic and CHEAP Thai food ever. Not the freshest and best quality ingredients in dishes as the ones in expensive thai joints, such as Patara at Tanglin Mall, but it's authentic as you can get, as the ones you'd eat in a normal restaurant in Thailand. We frequent this place as it's near our home, and love that we can order 7~8 dishes without breaking the bank. and the portions are pretty great. The line forms out the door at 5:30pm when it's opened for dinner as any other cheap and great for value dining in Sing, so come early to avoid queue. Must gets: (all around $5~8/dish)-Pandan Leaf Chicken. Tasty and plump chicken, wrapped in the leaf!-pineapple fried rice-shrimp pad thai-tom yum soup. portion is great and delicious-Basil minced pork. D loved it as it's full of flavor. -Green Curry-thai ice teaso-so's:-Mango sticky rice: mango is expectedly not as sweet as the ones you'd try in Thailand, but we expected more from the rice. the rice was hard and tasteless.-cereal shrimp. a bit soggy and not worth getting it here. better to spend more and get the perfectly cooked one at Jumbo or No signboard!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore. Cereal shrimps- a bit soggy
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore. Tom yum soup
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore. Some pork dish

sYFHU1vxdK8F4WoITK9oDw.text: Great taste good value and prompt service.This is those well run small restaurants that keeps its customers returning for the great taste and good value.We ordered five dishes; Tom yum, green curry, stir fried asparagus, pandan leave chicken and pineapple rice.The green curry is a winner for me, always my favorite and this place got it right. The prawn were fresh, and the curry is rich with a nice aroma of coconut, basil, and the long beans and fig were crunchy. The stir fried asparagus is a surprise, a good balance of garlic brought out the sweetness of the asparagus, the carrots is probably there to add color, but the prawns here is probably frozen thawed type. Pandan leaf chicken is a biggest pleasant surprise of all, very tender like otah, chicken chunks soft. A definite repeat order.Tom yum is well prepared. Good balance of spicy and sour, and seafood prawn and squid is fresh, I don't normally order Tom yum on my own, but this dish is good enough for me to try.I would not order the pineapple rice next time round. No comments on the taste but I do think white rice will bring out the tastes of the above dishes better.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore

rS6UDWR7gig93m6UAxg-AA.text: I went a few times and this will be the last time I went.  Food are the same standard but the services are still cold and chaotic, I waited 10 mins trying to get the bill, no one seems to care, I looked in the menu and left the cash behind then left, not feeling very comfortable about it. Well, people come for the price of the food not the service.

16DpcNmvsm9sl86vB-o45w.text: Excellent Thai food, service is fast but service level is just average.  Food very tasty, pricing good value

lKemTXdyGIE0zsp_ZUVw0A.text: Standard just constantly dropping and they obviously play very loud Thai music so as to deter customers from staying longer than normal.

W66NRwypPHT3hiabWXD7iQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find Nakhon Kitchen in my neighborhood so I decided to go there with my parents. we went on a Saturday evening around 6pm and found ourselves behind a long line of people. we eventually sat down after 35 mins of waiting; orders were taken while we were in line so it helped speed up the serving of dishes. we ordered olive fried rice, pandan leaf chicken, seafood tom yum with coconut milk, whole red fish thai style, kang kong belachan, mango salad, and cereal prawn. i really enjoyed all the dishes and as other reviews have said, the pandan leaf chicken was very good. i was excited about the cereal prawn because it was only $12 for quite a huge portion (based on what i saw on other tables before i ordered). the prawns didnt fail me and they were pretty big, fresh and succulent. i did however think that the cereal was lacking a little in taste when compared to what they serve at the zhi char stalls. for all that, including a mango glutinous rice to go and a coconut drink as well as a glass of lemon grass drink, we paid $67 and took home enough food for lunch next day. this place is certainly value for money! i would definitely go again!

C9F4_Mw6lq-2tF2au2524w.text: Helluva wait, but it's all worth it. Best Thai food I've had in a long time. I would recommend chili prawn and kang kong belachan.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakhon Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore. Pad Thai

GLs6bHSn5P9OYXPyq9S4zQ.text: Great tasting thai food! The line gets pretty long during dinner time, but the good thing is that they take your order while you are in line. When you get seated, your food is handed to you quickly. I love the pad thai here, probably the best I have tasted in Singapore so far. Also I recommend trying the green tea here!

zAwpI1KzUeD4vbwEh8K_Kg.text: Great thai place with authentic dishes and drinks. They have a good selection and their prices are really affordable ! Greatly recommended ! Come early as the place is always crowded

AJDTrDJgvi7X8tb07aFIhQ.text: With lines around the block, I do take-out now.. which means dining in at home with Nakhon Thai 3x a week. Yup, it's THAT good!  Wonderful staff - fast, polite; awesome tasting food.
